Software Engineer.question: Two Sum
Software Engineer.question_text: Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.

Software Engineer.question: Valid Parentheses
Software Engineer.question_text: Given a string s containing just the characters '(', ')', '{', '}', '[' and ']', determine if the input string is valid.

Software Engineer.question: Merge Two Sorted Lists
Software Engineer.question_text: Merge two sorted linked lists and return it as a sorted list.

Software Engineer.question: Binary Search
Software Engineer.question_text: Given a sorted array of integers and a target value, return the index if the target is found. If not, return the index where it would be if it were inserted in order.

Software Engineer.question: Flood Fill
Software Engineer.question_text: An image is represented by a 2D array of integers, each integer representing the pixel value. Implement the flood fill algorithm.

Senior Software Engineer.question: Add Two Numbers
Senior Software Engineer.question_text: You are given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers. Add the two numbers and return the sum as a linked list.

Senior Software Engineer.question: 3Sum
Senior Software Engineer.question_text: Given an integer array nums, return all the triplets [nums[i], nums[j], nums[k]] such that i != j, i != k, and j != k, and nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] == 0.

Senior Software Engineer.question: Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree
Senior Software Engineer.question_text: Given a binary tree, find the lowest common ancestor (LCA) of two given nodes in the tree.

Senior Software Engineer.question: Course Schedule
Senior Software Engineer.question_text: There are a total of numCourses you have to take, labeled from 0 to numCourses-1. Some courses have prerequisites. Determine if you can finish all courses.

Senior Software Engineer.question: Kth Largest Element in an Array
Senior Software Engineer.question_text: Find the kth largest element in an unsorted array.

Staff Software Engineer.question: Word Ladder
Staff Software Engineer.question_text: Given two words (beginWord and endWord), and a dictionary's word list, find the length of shortest transformation sequence from beginWord to endWord.

Staff Software Engineer.question: LRU Cache
Staff Software Engineer.category: Design, Hash Table, Doubly Linked List
Staff Software Engineer.question_text: Design and implement a data structure for Least Recently Used (LRU) cache.

Staff Software Engineer.question: Find Median from Data Stream
Staff Software Engineer.question_text: The median is the middle value in an ordered integer list. Implement the MedianFinder class to find the median from a data stream.

Staff Software Engineer.question: Merge k Sorted Lists
Staff Software Engineer.category: Heap, Linked List, Divide and Conquer
Staff Software Engineer.question_text: Merge k sorted linked lists and return it as one sorted list.

Staff Software Engineer.question: Implement Trie (Prefix Tree)
Staff Software Engineer.question_text: Implement a trie with insert, search, and startsWith methods.

Principal Engineer.question: Serialize and Deserialize Binary Tree
Principal Engineer.question_text: Design an algorithm to serialize and deserialize a binary tree.

Principal Engineer.question: Minimum Window Substring
Principal Engineer.question_text: Given two strings s and t, return the minimum window in s which will contain all the characters in t.

Principal Engineer.question: Alien Dictionary
Principal Engineer.question_text: Given a list of words from an alien language's dictionary, derive the order of letters in the alien language.

Principal Engineer.question: Design In-Memory File System
Principal Engineer.question_text: Design an in-memory file system to simulate the following functions: ls, mkdir, addContentToFile, and readContentFromFile.

Principal Engineer.question: Regular Expression Matching
Principal Engineer.question_text: Given an input string s and a pattern p, implement regular expression matching with support for '.' and '*'.
